intro: Siphocampylus sonchifolius var. tuerckheimii, commonly known as the Tuerckheim's tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a robust root system and upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with serrated edges, and are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
